website_summaries.verdict: Different size options in a compact design. A basic filter that's worth considering for novice aquarium hobbyists.
pros: Extremely quiet filter with a trim design
Straightforward for beginners to set up

customer_reviews.title: Not silent at all
customer_reviews.text: Love how quickly it clears the tank, disappointed on how loud the filter itself is. It's a loud vibrating/humming sound on my 10 gallon tank. I've tried everything from the impeller, adjusting the leveling knob, adjusting how it sits on the tank, lowering the flow control but no luck. The sound alone makes me want to switch back to my old filter that was silent but didn't clean that great.
customer_reviews.author: CNicole

customer_reviews.title: Works, that’s all that matters.
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this about six years ago and it did a decent job on my 15 gallon tank. It seems to keep it sufficiently clean, but it does tend to be a bit noisy due to the cover over the top of the filter rattling and buzzing against the sides. If it weren’t for that, it’d be a nice, quiet filter. It’s easy enough to clean and it lasted me a good six years before finally quitting on me. I’ve bought filters that lasted a lot less time. I liked it enough to order a replacement (and I think the price has gone down significantly since my first purchase).
customer_reviews.author: SHouser

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good filter if filled with proper bio media but electric pump is in the tank.
customer_reviews.text: As did another buyer, I tossed the filters that came with it and added filter sponges and bio filter media. With the plastic piece to stabilize it against the tank it is very quiet. It works okay but I am not convinced that I am getting enough water movement throughout the tank so I'm playing with the idea of adding a length of hose between the intake and outflow so I can have one at each end. I was also not impressed with the safety caution that I must turn the filter off before putting my hands in the tank to avoid electrocution!
customer_reviews.author: H. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5 gallons
customer_reviews.text: This filter is too small for anything over 5 gallons. Works well for small ones though. Super sleek and quiet and no issues yet. Don't use an air pump near this or it will suck all the bubbles up. The funny thing about this filter...I bought another one from p*tco and it is just as shallow and has a much more powerful pump and better filter baskets for the same price. I won't be recommending this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Mann

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, smooth, safe for shrimp!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter for my 29 gallon shrimp tank. My aquarium is a couple inches from a wall and the slim design of the filter squeezed in perfectly. The impeller is submerged so it's extremely quiet in my bedroom. It comes with a filter intake sponge which will prevent small fish and shrimp from getting sucked up. Overall a great and quiet hang on back filter for my shrimp aquarium
customer_reviews.author: Bryce C.

customer_reviews.title: IT'S PERFECT FOR SHRIMP AND FRY
customer_reviews.text: I got it initially for a different tank, with larger fish, but it is too slow to filter that one. However, it is perfect for my fry and shrimp tank. Didn't even think I'd ever find a hob for that! That "power" claim in the name is very misleading! It is great, only 92gph for slim 20 and it comes with prefilter sponge! Very safe for anything small and noise is nonexistent
customer_reviews.author: nebesnaya

customer_reviews.title: A month later, it's not working
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed fine, but almost exactly a month after I started using it (and after I discarded the box and packaging of course, so I can't try to return it) it has stopped pumping at all and the motor makes a very loud, harsh buzzing noise. It wasn't bumped or moved or anything like that, it just started with this ridiculous noise and now it doesn't work so... I'm disappointed that it didn't start doing this sooner so I could return it, I really shouldn't have thrown the box away. I'd look elsewhere for a filter. The price is nice on this but you will only get it for a very, very brief time.
customer_reviews.author: Rorschach

customer_reviews.title: Great LIttle Filter
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 10 gallon divided betta tank. I have one for each side. I had to add the fluval prefilter to the intake pump but it does the job. I will say it occasionally would hum but if I messed with it enough it would stop humming. There is a small plastic piece that touches the glass of the tank and if it wasn't sitting right it would rattle. I moved the tank out of my room now and I never hear it anymore. I don't recommend keeping tanks in bedrooms anyways because of noise but for a common area of the house you'll never hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Blair

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing filter. Easy to set up and keeps the goldfish's tank super clear. The first few days the water was a little cloudy like some other reviewers stated but that’s normal. Just have to be patient. When there’s a change usually cloudy water follows due to a “bacterial bloom.” As long as you use the right water conditioner and wait a couple or a few days it will all clear right up. We have a goldfish and they are pretty messy but the tank has never looked so clean now that we have this filter. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Tracie2106

customer_reviews.title: Great little filter
customer_reviews.text: Great little filter for my 10 gallon. I tossed to included filters and just use aquarium sponges that will save one a lot of cash in the long run—cycle your tanks people. It runs very quietly. I have my aquarium by my bed and there is almost no noise unless you allow a little waterfall or the cord gets positioned in a way that can cause vibrations against the glass. It’s easy to adjust the water flow depending on your needs. I generally use this brand of power filters for my tropical fish tanks and would recommend to others no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: IT'S SO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is about this filter that makes it so loud! And it's not the motor, it's the fact that water condenses on every surface and drips constantly and loudly. If you don't have your water level constantly touching the opening of the filter where the wheel is, it's the most distracting and loud dripping ever, that you can't ever tune out. Drives me absolutely insane.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my shrimp tank with the sponge pre-filter
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quiet and thin, letting me get the tank closer to the back wall. The flow of water does come in from one end and is then supposed to come through evenly the broad way across two filter pads, and I'm not sure how even the flow is. I really just wanted somewhere to load a bunch more biological filtration and wasn't going to use the intended pads. I'm sure it'll work, but I'm not certain how good the flow will be through all of that media. Otherwise, no complaints so far when used as intended.
customer_reviews.author: GallopingCow

customer_reviews.title: Superb little filter
customer_reviews.text: I do plan on using this with my own media at some point, but out of the box it was easy to set up and very quiet. The only thing I will complain about is that the intake sponge, which is probably fine for fish, has gaps that are too large for shrimp breeding. I purchased a Fluval Edge intake sponge, and it fits over the intake perfectly. I think this is my new favorite filter. It is certainly a LOT more quiet than the air pump that was driving the sponge filter I had in the tank before!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well at all!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this filter because the all-In filter that came with the aquarium was horrible, also. I’ve already changed the water twice in only two weeks Of having it, and my water is extremely dirty and foggy after just cleaning for the the second time a couple days ago. This filter does not work well at all! Don’t waste your money. I have no idea how this has so many good reviews. Doesn’t make any sense.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson K

customer_reviews.title: nice little filter
customer_reviews.text: I've been running this on a 20 gal long planted aquarium with 24 fish. The filter keeps up and operates quietly. I fill the first chamber where the water pumps into with fluval prefilter media, the second chamber I fill with poly fill, and I line the bottom of the next 3 chambers with fluval bio rings and place mesh sacks of seachem seagel and purigen on top. This setup provides a good water flow but is not super energetic and seems to keep things well balanced. I clean the tank about once a week and clean out the filter about once a month. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Saved my green fish tank.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I have a ten gallon tank with one goldfish that suffered a massive algae bloom after the sucker fish died. You could see more than an inch into the water no matter how much I cleaned the tank or what chemicals I used. I bought this filter and within an hour you could see a difference and five hours later the tank was almost clear. Overnight and it was crystal clear. I will have to replace the cartridges but I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tischler

customer_reviews.title: Was Great At First—
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this filter! I’ve had a really hard time with trying to keep filters alive and working with my 5.5 gallon tank, I’ve gone through a few now. I was really excited with the sleek look when it came, and it worked excellently for the first month. I did my water changes, switched out the cartridges regularly, but then the flow control valve stopped working and the water flowed out in a tiny stream! I kept switching out cartridges to try and troubleshoot it, I replaced the sponge tip, I rinsed out the tube, but nothing was helping. I’m very disappointed and ordering a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Gracelyn

customer_reviews.title: Started out great then stopped doing its job.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this filter on my 10 gallon tank for about 4 months now. At first it was great, the water stayed nice and clear, I thought it was great. Then out of nowhere about a month ago it just stopped doing it's job. I have to completely clean and change the water in my tank every 2-3 days now otherwise it gets so cloudy and green that I can't even see my fish in it. I've changed the cartridges regularly and kept it clean like you are suppose to. The only good thing about this filter is if you tuck the power cord underneath it, it is pretty silent. I wont be wasting my money on this filter again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my betta fish alive!
customer_reviews.text: All I know is that since getting this filter, our kids betta fish is still alive and happy. Previous "carnival" fish didn't make it with the cheaper filters I purchased from Walmart. It's super quiet and just works. I don't know why anyone would find this filter loud, it makes absolutely no noise at all. Pros: the replacement filter cartridges are easy to find anywhere and not very expensive. Plus, I think you can add in your own filter material if you want to. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Nakamo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This was so far one of the best purchases I have made while keeping fish. I just set it up and am seriously astounded by how quiet this filter is. And it's the best filter I've used for a betta fish. You can adjust the flow quite low which I think he will like. I am using it for a 20 gallon that will house a betta and 2 adfs. I will update if I have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amzwizzer

customer_reviews.title: Got loud quickly
customer_reviews.text: So this is my 2nd time purchasing this same power filter. The first one seemed fine initially, once I had it all set up it worked just fine and was super quiet. For some reason, about 3 weeks in, the filter starting getting louder and louder and now it is almost at an intolerable level. I'm going to try my luck with a new filter and hope that this one STAYS quiet. Will update review once I find out.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: A good filter, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Saying that this filter is slim is an understatement. It is way thinner than any hang on back filter you've ever seen. It takes up practically no space behind your tank. However, the pump being in the tank was a quirk that I was unfortunately unable to deal with. If you have a big enough decoration or enough plants to block it from sight, this filter is a great buy. Otherwise, a traditional one will look better.
customer_reviews.author: Linh P.

customer_reviews.title: Great, quiet filter for an aquatic animal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter to replace one that never worked quite right (bought at a local pet store). This one is perfect. We keep the tank only 1/2 full of water because there are 5 African clawed frogs in it, and if there's more water, they try to jump out. The filter works beautifully and quietly even with the tank less than full. I've never had a problem with it getting clogged or with the water stopping or not starting to begin with. It's a great filter that requires only minimal maintenance. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Ziegmont

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like a miniaturized AQUAClear...just want I needed and wanted!!!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome tiny filter! It’s definitely keeping my 5 gal Nano tank clean, as it is over-stalked. It fits GREAT on my Fluval Chi. It’s extremely silent, though sometimes, it vibrates a bit loud (the motor is inside the tank on the intake) and I need to adjust placement of the intake. Love it! Also- you can treat this like an Aqua Clear...all media can be customized ;)
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Flexon

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Mostly Quiet
customer_reviews.text: In videos, Marina refers to this as "silent." It isn't. It's very quiet, but it's not silent. And it was buzzing from time to time, which I eventually realized was coming from the lid vibrating, so I've toyed with how to weight the lid down more. Also, the leveling peg keeps falling out-- it REALLY should be attached and not just a weird extra little piece that you push in. Other than that, it seems to work well and have plenty of room for customization. The self-primer works great. It doesn't filter out small particles, though.
customer_reviews.author: Space Salamander

customer_reviews.title: Moves water in the tank but it's not very good at actually filtering
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok filter. Moves water in the tank but it's not very good at actually filtering. I like the design and I like that it has something to cover the intake so my Betta doesn't get his fins caught but other than that not super good as a filter.
customer_reviews.author: CanaryCry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bettas!
customer_reviews.text: I love these filters. I have 2 in my 20L, one on each side. I have a betta so hanging filters are usually a problem, but these are the solution. It cleans the tank and doesn't have a lot of water pressure coming into the tank. The clear filters do not look the oretties with all of the algae build up, but it is not that big of a deal because I can see how it is building up my tank water. I highly reccomend these over other types!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Braun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Effective, Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Quiet filter, I have 2 bettas in a 10 gallon tank with about 6-8 Mossballs with a divider, so 5 gallons for each fish. This filter is extremely quiet , just be sure to use the tab at the bottom to position and keep it from vibrating against the glass. If i fill the water up and close to the filter's "waterfall" I cannot even hear the water drop back into the tank, Which means absolutely no sound from filter or water. If you like the sound of running water just lower the water in tank. Overall amazing and extremely quiet filter, I was surprised since some of the reviews say it was loud..
customer_reviews.author: Shreyas Nampalli

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 gallon tank a month ago and it did Nothing! My tank is very dirty and stinky and the filter cartridges are still clean and white as if still new. This filter has no suction. Now I have to empty the tank and fill with new water and buy another filter..
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy, but nice and thin.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the filter is thin so the tank doesn't have to be so far away from the wall, but it is much too noisy. I keep it in our living room and there are nights that it starts rattling so loud that it wakes up the kids in their bedrooms down the hall. I've tried many things to stop the rattling but nothing seems to work. I'm gonna have to get a new filter.
customer_reviews.author: RBI

customer_reviews.title: LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is so irritating! It vibrates and makes a humming noise that none of us can bare. I've tried everything to pad it so it doesn't vibrate but the second the kids run through the house, and it gets jiggled even the slightest, it's right back to that unbearable hum. Soon as my new pump comes in this one is going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing design, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: This filter is awesome it's so quiet it's so thin and sleek if it wasn't for the submerged pump in the water you wouldn't even know it was there I highly recommend this item to others to purchase even if this thing breaks down I will be buying another one but it looks like it's built to last. my absolute favorite feature is the open media area that you can modify to the way you like as a hang on sump for a smaller tank this is great
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Garcia

customer_reviews.title: easy to use fish like it
customer_reviews.text: its a little filter it is very narrow but cleans my tank the pre filter on the intake gets clogged easy i have large goldfish in a 20 gallon i mean large he eats pea size pellets... i have trouble finding the replacement filter pads so i make my own and fill with carbon and zeolite mix ... isn't noisy unless the water level falls
customer_reviews.author: T Gorain

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap but it does not work well, you will pay alot in filter changes.
customer_reviews.text: This filter was cheap but the design of the filters are not efficient since the water does not flow in stages like other filters. All 3 filter are side by side and inlet flow goes through them at the same times making it more dirty and inefficient. Buy the the filter with pre-filter so that carbon and bio filter does not need to be changed as often. I do not recommend this filter.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little filter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter for my 5 gallon tank and it is working beautifully since day 1. It took me 5 min to get it up and running and it is SO quiet, I can't hear it even with nothing else on in the room. The water flow is adjustable and perfect for the surface space of my tank. My little goldfishes are loving it, highly recommend this filter!
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is quiet & keeps the tank clean. I have a monster sized (lol) goldfish that gets bigger with every tank upgrade. Goldfish can be messy but this keeps the water clear & clean.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install & Customize! Super Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I added this filter to a ten gallon tank. I generally don't like HOB filters because they can be noisy and just not pleasant to look at. This filter is sleek-looking and super quiet. I like the look of it and you cannot hear it at all. I wasn't sure if it was actually running when I first powered it up. In one of the three filter compartments inside, I installed a pouch of Purigen. My water is crystal clear. I would definitely recommend this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nocella

customer_reviews.title: Best most quiet filter ever
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best filter ever. It is the quietest filter I have ever had. I have tried several and I did a lot of research. I took a chance on this one and it was the best purchase. Easy to change filters and super quiet. Do not buy aqueon quiet flow because it is the loudest thing ever. This marina filter is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Fun mom

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far she is going strong. I've often times purchased filtration systems from local shops that just dont hold up. This one has been good to me so far and is pretty easy to clean. I like that the motor is low into the water, will probably help it to not burn up as easily for whatever reason, versus the filters with the motors mounted on the back of the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L.

customer_reviews.title: I love these filters
customer_reviews.text: I love these filters. Im slowly switching all the HOB filters I have to these. I don't use the cartridges they come with I cut a sponge to fit and/or use filter floss. The fluval sponges fit almost perfectly. I have 2 of the S20's and I have some of the smaller ones coming. The s20 would prob be ok on a low stocked 30-40 gallon. Im gonna use 2 as I have a lot of fish in one tank. The S20 is perfect for a 20 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Warning: can be noisy with rattling
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how this filter worked, it's sleekness was great, unfortunately the 2 I bought would rattle constantly, and vibrate the whole tank. Even if I removed the lid from the tank and the filter it was still very noisy. I took them both apart to make sure there wasn't any sand particles in the motor- nothing. Very disappointed. Too noisy for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G.

customer_reviews.title: quiet and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: i am very impressed, especially for the price! comes with everything you need (pump, filter, plug in, etc) and is essentially silent. super easy setup. the adjustable flow makes it perfect for a betta fish or anything that needs a very slow current.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: very weak suction power
customer_reviews.text: this pump is rated for 10 gallons but the water barely reaches the top of the tube that connects the pump to the reservoir. Water is coming out very slow. Also upset the set of filters I bought with this pump that cannot be returned. At the moment this pump is being used in my 2.5 gallon betta tank. I had to get a different brand of pump for installed my 10 gallon tank because this one just does not work. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Allucard

customer_reviews.title: it makes an excellent cat water fountain
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to how this works as an aquarium filter because that's not what I use it for, but installed on a 1 or 2-gallon tote, and with filtration media removed, it makes an excellent cat water fountain. Makes a ton of noise with the cover on, though, so I just removed it. If all you need is water movement, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybuttorama

customer_reviews.title: crystal clear water quick
customer_reviews.text: weird directions but easy to figure out. crystal clear water after only one day. my old pump died and had been off for a week or so. the tank was getting green. this filter cleared my tank up quickly. it's bigger than I thought it would be. tank is 10 gallons.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great match for old chrome sided tank
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 10, and 15 of this model I like how it looks and the slimness in back of the tank. It's easily adjustable for a betta if you want to turn down the flow. Also the pump is in the water so just plug it it and it's working, no need to pour water into the filter to get it going. I also really like the look of it with my retro tank, the silver detail on the lid matches my chrome framed vintage aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P.

customer_reviews.title: THE Best
customer_reviews.text: This filter is the best filter I have ever bought. It is extremely quiet and I like the way the water is dispensed back into the tank. With this design it lowers the force of the current even on max flow. I especially love how it has the 2 filter slots so you can alternate the 2 different types (zeolite and carbon) or you can use it for filter media and create your own. All without taking up a lot of space. I have very fine black sand in a standard 10 gal aquarium and it is not disturbed or sucked into the filter. For the price I paid for this filter I feel like I ripped them off.
customer_reviews.author: bad_kitty13

customer_reviews.title: A really great filter for people who want to customize their media!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw the reviews of other and fell in love. I love the fact that the body is clear. The inside is spacious enough to customize the media of choice and lastly, I love fact that you can adjust the flow rate. I used a floss filter with a polisher as the pre filter, a bio foam and packed one side with biohome ultimate media. I love this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Big

customer_reviews.title: Awkward in tank
customer_reviews.text: The entire motor for this pump sits in the tank itself, which means that it is extremely noticeable in a 10 gallon tank. This also means that there is a ton of space for filter media inside the filter itself. I would definitely recommend getting rid of the filter cartridges and just adding a biological filter media.
customer_reviews.author: PropagandaByPhD

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's in my 10 gallon betta/shrimp tank. I love the adjustable flow and it's the nicest looking filter I've ever seen! I took the springs off the filtration tube, wasn't a fan of how bulky it looks and feel like it will clean up the tank better.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Gentle
customer_reviews.text: So quiet! And so much better than my previous ones. I was a newbie and wanted to go cheap for filters but the fishes grew on me so I wanted to give them a better life. It’s been going great so far and I’m pleased and so are the fishes. We will see how long it’ll last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this filter for my 5 gallon betta tank ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter for my 5 gallon betta tank because is cheap, quiet and has adjustable flow. I was able to get the flow low enough to not bother my fish while still effectively keeping my tank clean. I bought cheaper media that I put in the filter when it was time to replace the stuff it came with and it works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Large

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even clean the water
customer_reviews.text: This filter let the water become brown and let a film form on the top of the water, there was barely a current (which is one of the seeking points), it also stopped filtering the gunk it caused (I only have a betta and a crab in the tank so it’s not the fish causing the gunk, also the water was probably turning brown from the drift wood prices I have in the tank).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny quiet filter that is super easy to clean and even looks good
customer_reviews.text: Tiny quiet filter that is super easy to clean and even looks good. I wish more stores sold Marina filters so that I could buy them anywhere, but so far you can only get them online
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality & Best Price.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Tetra, Aqueon, Aqua-Tech, and Marina filters. I'd rate Aqueon second best, but you absolutely cannot beat these filters. They can utilize any type of filter medium without detriment to the water flow (Aqua-tech won't work properly without their brand of filter). The Aqueons are nice, I've used the honeycomb filter for aquaponics with phenomenal results. But this filter (S15) always, always, always, works 100% of the time. I bought this filter for my 20G long guppy breeding tank after using the S10 in my Betta breeding 10G.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these filters (2 S10s and 1 S20) within a month of eachother (early June, mid June, early July 2016). I liked the simple, slim design, the ease of customizing the media, and the fact that you can dry start them. However, within the last two weeks all of them began behaving erratically. It was like the motors were not pulling the same amount of water consistently. Sometimes the flow would be normal, sometimes there would barely be a trickle. I rinsed the pre filter sponges every week-ish, and cleaned the intake pipe with Marina's brushes every two weeks. I've since replaced them with Aquaclears. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Elisabeth Howard

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buyer.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little filter. I LOVE that it is self priming. I put pinky floss or quilt batting in mine to polish my water. They are super thin and make it possible for the Aquarium to be much closer to the wall than other HOB filters. Good filter and the price can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable Flow!
customer_reviews.text: This filter is great for my 10 gallon aquarium! Easy to assemble and the adjustable flow is perfect for bettas! Highly recommend for fish keepers who who need low flow filters. It takes two cartridges which are a great price as well for this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Matara Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Great filter.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter, nice and quiet and easy to customize with your own filter media. Plus it's clear so you can easily see inside the filter and see what's going on in there. I will probably purchase this type of filter if I need to replace any of my other filters.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSerfes

customer_reviews.title: Great flow, customizable
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far! It is virtually silent, moves a lot of water, and is sleek and slim. I also love that you can add your own filter media if you wish, because I use pure gen in my tank and also like to stick live plants in the tops of my filters ;) just got is yestersay, love it so far. Will update if anything changes or if it breaks sooner than a $16 filter should!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright for a Betta Fish
customer_reviews.text: I like this filter and it works like it should, but it seems to give off a loud hum inside of the tank. It also will vibrate loudly if not placed a certain way. It works great and my betta is fine, but the loud hum inside the tank is a little iffy.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Collier

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price my betta is happy; control valve is adjustable so on lowest setting for bettas...easy to clean as well. Filters are ok priced but I love my betta he's worth it
customer_reviews.author: tortuga

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, fits on 40 Gal
customer_reviews.text: I used to think the Aquaclear filters were the best but, they were just too loud and noisy. This is the quietest HOB filter I've ever used. It fits on my 40 Gal. It's perfect for my fancy goldfish. If you plan to customize your filter, order the S20. The S10 and S15 are better suited for the cartridges that come with them. My only complaint is that I wish there was more space inside the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: Best budget filter
customer_reviews.text: By far these are the best budget filters on the market. Absolutely silent and you can use your own media instead of the ones provided. I am currently running 4 of these on seperate tanks and have been for about 2 years. Havent been let down yet. 10/10 would reccomend for everyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but wimpy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very slim and quiet little filter. However, it is not nearly powerful enough to give you decent water flow in a 20 gallon tank. They should have the maximum tank size listed as 10 gallons. It needs at least double the amount of water flow in order to provide enough oxygen for the fish
customer_reviews.author: Michael krohn

customer_reviews.title: Keeping aquarium healthy
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my 5 gallon tank. The unit can go buzzzzz sometimes but the cascading water sound masks that somewhat. The unit can be a bit difficult to clean in parts, but overall works well. Most importantly, it been doing it's job by keeping my fishes healthy!
customer_reviews.author: lucy k.

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad
customer_reviews.text: The motor is too weak for my liking and the leveler under the filter is a bit annoying to mess with because it's too loose. Ended up having to hot glue it into place so it'll stop falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Cey

customer_reviews.title: Safe for fry
customer_reviews.text: I have it on a rimless aquarium and have the water filled all the way to the top so there is no waterfall effect. Runs very quiet. My 3 blood Parrot Cichlid fry are safe , with the sponge over the water intake, no risk of being sucked up. So far it's running very nice 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and flow is adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed, flow is adjustable and filter is extremely quiet. Filter media designed for it is costly so I am using my own and it seems to be working. Currently filter is running to build beneficial bacteria then will be put into a tank with fish. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: BookJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to give 3 star but it’s a decent filter, it’s just not good for what I wanted it for. Inside I feel is too small and pump could be a bit stronger. But I also have a lot of bio media so that could also be why. Just not what I really wanted but am repurposing the pump for a hob refuge so not a total loss I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Halley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter.
customer_reviews.text: After using a number of different filters over the years, this is the best one that we've come across. The motor actually goes in the water which has two good effects. It makes it much more quiet and eliminates a potential leakage point. The only reason that I am not giving it 5 stars is that the first one we bought broke after 2-3 years. Parts were available to fix it, but it was cheap enough that it was almost disposable and cheaper to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: the best filter I’ve ever tried
customer_reviews.text: So far the filter is running nicely, has adequate space for stuffing in bio media. It kept power and suction and ran flawlessly, I love it so much that I would like to stick to these filters from now on. I TRUST this filter, which I can’t say about my penn plax or aquaclear filters that like to die randomly or never turn back on after a water change. I’m not a fan of the big, bulky motor being inside the tank and This filter isn’t good for rimless aquariums, it’s slanted backwards and doesn’t look right. Those are my only complaints
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the video is louder than what it actually is because I was so close. But I got this filter for beta fish 5.5 gal tank. I wanted something good but cheap and this is it. It cleaned my mucky algae water to crystal clear in like 2 hours if that. It was super easy to assemble too
customer_reviews.author: mitsukia

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one we've purchased...
customer_reviews.text: Our first unit was very quiet and seemed to work well but only lasted about a year. This new one is very noisy and rattles a lot. Will be ordering a different brand of filter this week.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely excellent filter. I replaced the slide in filters with ...
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely excellent filter. I replaced the slide in filters with a foam mesh and a biological filter has set up. Very quiet, although at times, there can be a slight vibration where the filter rests on the tank. A slight adjustment will fix that though. The water runs very quietly as well. If you have it on the lowest setting, the water flow is very laminar, and with a high enough water setting, the filter is absolutely silent. I use it with a betta fish, even on the lowest setting, it disturbs the surface of the water enough that he won't make bubble nests, I'm not sure if this is a good or bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice and slim!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Nice and quiet. Very slim, I was in the market for some filter that has a skinny filter box. This did the trick and it only took up about 1 and 1/2 inches of space. And I also like the motor that is right by the tubes, so it can auto prime with no water in the filter box. Comes with a pre filter for intake as well
customer_reviews.author: TuneSquad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I got so sick of loud and ineffective fish tank filters. This one is the bomb - very inexpensive for the quality, easy to assemble with understandable directions, and they preforms like a charm. I have never see a tank so crystal clear. The best I've had in many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Considine

customer_reviews.title: Great filter! I use this in my 10 gallon ...
customer_reviews.text: Great filter! I use this in my 10 gallon tank with a Betta in it. It's nice that you can change the flow settings because it can get really powerful or very soft, Bettas prefer a soft current. Keeps the tank pretty clean on it's own, replacement filters a decently priced, and it's quiet. I can hear a small sound/vibration but not bad at all. Kind of soothing background noise once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Lennox

customer_reviews.title: I highly doubt this filter would be useful on a 20 gallon
customer_reviews.text: Filter is mediocre. Bought the S20, the water flow is very weak for this filter. Even when setting the filter valve to high the flow remains weak. Its noisy and vibrate a lot. I highly doubt this filter would be useful on a 20 gallon, let alone a 10 gallon. I use this filter in my quarantine tank, would not consider this a main tank filter.
customer_reviews.author: Don't drink and Prime

customer_reviews.title: Will Buy More if I Need to Replace It
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy use. No need to fill up with water before turning it on, easy to replace filter cartridges, and extremely quiet. 100% would recommend and buy again
customer_reviews.author: Marina Keyzer

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet
customer_reviews.text: This was ok...it worked but was kinda loud and very annoying, definately not quiet
customer_reviews.author: Tracy  A Aicardi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job..
customer_reviews.text: Overall good. Does the job. However- if it's not in the exact right place it makes a lot of sound, not ideal considering the vibrations make it constantly move. Sometimes keeps me up at night, but at least it's doing my fish well.
customer_reviews.author: elliott

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: SHOULD HAVE REPLACED WITH AN ''S15-SIZE''. MY MISTAKE,THOUGHTI HAD A TEN-GAL. IT WILL SERVE IN AN EMERGENCY, AS BACK-UP. MARINA BRAND HAS BEEN EXCELLENT OVERALL.
customer_reviews.author: Svenska

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this filter....but there’s one problem
customer_reviews.text: It really doesn’t filter well. I’ve had a dozen filters and this one seemed well received, so I checked it out and it ran gloriously for three weeks and the water flow out of it became slower and slower. Now it’s barely spitting out any water. I did a water change two days ago and cleaned the whole filter and it’s just not doing anything. So close.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Row

customer_reviews.title: Great Filters!
customer_reviews.text: Great filters! Super quiet, great suction, self priming, nice discharge flow, and clear housing is great. Own 3 now and would definitely recommend. Just replaced my Aqueon Quietflow with 2 of the S20 versions.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Too much maintainence.  Threw it out.
customer_reviews.text: It worked good but it was too loud and too much work to clean or maintain it. I just don't have time to be buying new filters and changing it every so often. Switched back to my old filter w/in a month and now this one is just sitting out in the backyard collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and was not disappointed. Using it on a 5 gal tank. The motor is quite and the water flow is more that adequate for this size tank. I really like the course sponge pre-filter and the ability to arrange the filter media any way I want.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but some issues!
customer_reviews.text: While the filter seems to work well, it arrived damaged with a crack through the output. It isn’t affecting its function but I keep an eye on it. Even on its lowest setting the output flows pretty hard. Wouldn’t recommend for a beta tank but probably great for stream fish or plants. Love the compartments for custom medium.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T.

customer_reviews.title: Great little filter
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 5-10 gallon tank, this is the filter you want. Will keep tank spotless. Motor for filter is submerged, I keep checking to make sure it's plugged in, no noise at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Too low flow, poor suction
customer_reviews.text: Filter keeps flowing slower and slower as the days go by! Currently have it in a five gallon Betta tank and it's struggling. There's adjustable flow which would be nice if there was any. Filter is fairly easy to change/clean. Noise isn't terrible but will hum if not balanced.
customer_reviews.author: corndogmurphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Filter
customer_reviews.text: This pump simply functions great. Very quiet. Just change out the cartridges. I check the cartridges every two weeks and they are really dirty, which means the filter is doing its job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy W. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This is the best filter I've ever owned! (not that I've had many but it's great nonetheless) This filter is very quite and it keeps the water absolutely clear for weeks on end! There's nothing bad I can say about this. Most of it sits on the back behind the tank so it doesn't take up room inside the tank. It has a setting for how high or low power on the filter which is great and it also comes with a cover for the filter so your little guppies won't get sucked up. Overall, this is great and I recommend it for anyone, even novices like me :)
customer_reviews.author: Megen

customer_reviews.title: Strong silent filter, effective, compact and impressive
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase, I couldn't believe how such a small filter could clean so well. It is excellent for smaller aquariums, the design is great and the function is spectacular, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Dominika K. Pinkowski

customer_reviews.title: customize it and build 5 times more surface area than other filters
customer_reviews.text: Threw away the filter medias that come with this for good! You can custom-build 5 times more surface area with just sponges and ceramic than similar models such as Fluva C2, AquaClear 20, Penguin Marineland (i actually bought all and tested them). Its working pretty amazing...
customer_reviews.author: Nimolee

customer_reviews.title: Engine that could
customer_reviews.text: Small little HOB, very thin but it's longer that I thought it would be, but that is not the reason I dock a star. I wish they would of perfected the hood design. I have 2 of these and they have a tendancy to rattle, a little annoyance. So I just sit my fish food on top of the lid to stop it from vibrating all the time. The filter is very easy to tear apart and clean which is a plus. Overall I'm satisfied no major gripes about this product. Tip: The filter gaps are wide enough for install Seachem 100M Purgen filter with no side affects other than crystal clear water!
customer_reviews.author: Stickyickyooo

customer_reviews.title: Instruction confusion
customer_reviews.text: In the instructions for the filtering system is says that tap water will kill the good bacteria, but on the filter's instructions it shows to rinse the filters under a faucet. We aren't sure how to rinse it before putting it into the tank, or if we even should. Has anyone found this problem and what to do about it? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Maui, Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Loud hum
customer_reviews.text: This filter worked great for the first few months but now it has developed a loud hum. This normally wouldn't be an issue, but since this filter is so small I used it for a desk top nano. I can't get the humming to stop and it's driving me up a wall. I will be replacing this filter with something else in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Ven H

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I have had aquariums for over 50 years. I remember when power filters first came out. This one may be the best I've had. Planning on buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the money
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked as expected, it is quiet, and provides good suction. My only problem is I have to order the filters on Amazon since no one local carries them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken Filter Box
customer_reviews.text: The plastic box that holds the water, was badly damaged. It was cracked with a big hole, when I got it. There were plastic pieces in the bottom of the box. I was unable to operate the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Hector J. Lugo

product_meta.title: Marina Power Filter
product_meta.description: Style:Up to 20| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Slim S20 Power Filter's unique design is compact and slim, thus reducing space behind your aquarium. The filter comes equipped with an adjustable flow control so you can control the water flow level in your tank. Its motor is submerged in the tank for a quiet operation and an easy start-up since no priming is required. Just plug in and go! Installation and maintenance are quick, easy and convenient and the Slim S20 Power Filter includes 4 filter cartridges: 2 Bio-Carb and 2 Bio-Clear. Both cartridges contain Ceramitek, which is engineered to optimize biological filtration, for a healthy aquarium.
feature_bullets: Power filter for aquariums up to 20 gallons

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
